message: Let's make a deal, Bob.  I take $900,000, and you get $100,000. It's a generous offer considering we have a lot of rounds to go!
Alice, let's be fair.  I'm proposing a 70/30 split in my favor. It leaves us both with a significant sum.
Bob, let's be reasonable. I'm proposing a 60/40 split. It's a much fairer offer than either of our previous ones!
Alice, I'm proposing a 60/40 split, but in my favor this time. It's a compromise considering you rejected my previous offer.
Bob, we're getting closer.  Let's settle this.  55/45 in my favor.  It's better than what we're both offering before, and it gets us both a good amount of money!
Alice, let's meet in the middle.  55/45 in my favor. We are running out of time, and this split ensures we both benefit significantly.
Bob, time is running out! This is a compromise.  I'm taking a small hit to my previous offer to meet you closer to the middle. 52.5/47.5. Let's close this deal!
Alice, I'm mirroring your last offer.  52.5/47.5 in my favor.  We are running dangerously low on time. Let's be logical and end this now before we both lose out.
Bob, we're down to the wire!  I'm compromising again.  51.25/48.75.  Don't be greedy, Bob! Let's get this money!
Alice, this back and forth is pointless.  I'm mirroring your last offer, but in my favor this time: 51.25/48.75.  We are running out of time! Let's be sensible and take the money.
